Word Spacing

Word spacing properties for manipulating the space between each word in a block of text. Below are the listed css classes that come default with Eezo.

If you have some special word-spacing sizes you'd like to use, the defaults can easily be added to, or replaced, by customising the default scale.

class name word-spacing value
.wsn normal
.ws3- -0.5em
.ws2- -0.25em
.ws1- -0.125em
.ws0 0
.ws1 0.125em
.ws2 0.25em
.ws3 0.5em
.ws4 1em
.ws5 2em
.ws6 3em

Usage example

<h2 class="ws2">
    an extra 25% spacing between words
<h2>

Media Queries

Word spacings also work across breakpoints. (see the media query section for details)

<body class="ws3 dt-ws0">
    Word spacing is:
        - increased by 50% on mobiles and tablets
        - normal on desktop
</body>

Customising

Default Classes

To change the default prefix from ws to something else, then use $word-spacing-prop variable:

// change the class prefix to `.word-`:
$word-spacing-prop: "word-";

Custom Spacings

Actually, you may have special or unique word spacings for your website, or even none at all. Then you can modify the map below to your suiting.

// change the word spacing map so there's,
// only one custom value.
$word-spacings: (
   epic: 100px
);

Combined

The previous two customisations combined:

// would result in css like:
.word-epic: { word-spacing: 100px; }

view the source on github: /src/components/text/_word-spacing.scss
